clinical_study.brief_title: Early Intensive Physical Therapy in Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Early Intensive Physical Therapy for Patients With Subarachnoid Hemorrhage in a Neurological ICU

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the safety and feasibility of early intensive physical therapy for patients diagnosed with subarachnoid hemorrhage. Intervention will begin in the neurological ICU and continue for 30 days or hospital discharge.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Physical function in the ICU test (PFit)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 7 days until hospital discharge or 28 days of study enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Activity Measure for Post-Acute Care (AM-PAC) mobility
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 7 days until hospital discharge or 28 days of study enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Timed up and Go (TUG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 7 days until hospital discharge or 28 days of study enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Postural Assessment Scale for Stroke Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 7 days until hospital discharge or 28 days of study enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Medical Research Council (MRC) Muscle Sum Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 7 days until hospital discharge or 28 days of study enrollment
Every 7 days until hospital discharge or 28 days of study enrollment

other_outcome.description: Neuro-QOL measures 17 domains of health related quality of life for adults through self-report.. We will use the short form versions for applied cognition, lower extremity mobility and Upper extremity function and Satisfaction with social roles/activities.

arm_group.description: Early intensive physical therapy will be the intervention arm. There is not a control group.

intervention.description: Early Intensive Physical therapy in the ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed by CT scan or MRI with subarachnoid hemorrhage and admitted to the neurological ICU >48 hours.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant language barrier that would limit the ability to participate in the physical therapy program
- Severe baseline physical or cognitive impairment that would impair their ability to participate in the protocol
- Patients whose vital signs are outside the accepted starting and stopping criteria outlined below:
1. intracranial pressure ≤ 15 mm Hg
2. Cerebral perfusion pressure >50 or <70 mm Hg
3. Mean arterial pressure ≥ 80 and ≤ 110
4. Heart rate ≥40 and <140 bpm
5. Pulse oximetry >88%
